refnamediv.refpurpose: Read multiple input streams and multiplex them into stdout

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: fdlinecombine is a utility to read multiple input streams and multiplex them into stdout\n"
Parameters should be file descriptor numbers or file names
You can use the -s option, the --separator-from-file option or the --separator option, to change the character or characters to separate lines.

listitem.para: Sets the string used as separator
if set, don't output trailing line without separator at the end
Read the file separator from filename or file descriptor

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.programlisting: fdlinecombine -s 10 0 5 6 <(echo HEADER; echo ---) 5< <((nc -lp 9979 </dev/null) \ 6< <(perl -e '$|=1; sleep 2 and print \ \"TIMER\\n---\\n\" while true' < /dev/null) \ 10< <(printf -- '\\n---\\n') > out
refsect1.para: This will transfer data from stdin, opened TCP port and periodic timer to file "out" using "---" line as separator.
